items.title: Document title
items.help_text: The title of the metadata document (which will usually be the same as the element "Title" in the "DCMI / Image description" section). The metadata document is the metadata file (XML or JSON file) that is being generated.

items.title: Document ID
items.help_text: A unique identifier for the image's metadata document. This identifier must be unique in the catalog where the metadata are intended to be published. Ideally, the identifier should also be unique globally. This is different from the "Primary ID" in section "Image identifiers", although it is good practice to generate identifiers that establish a clear connection between these two identifiers. The Document ID could also include the metadata document version identifier. For example, if the "Primary ID" of the image is “IMG_0001”, the Document ID could be “IHSN_IMG_001_v1.0” if the metadata are produced by the IHSN and if this is version 1.0 of the metadata. Each organization should establish systematic rules to generate such IDs. A validation rule can be set (using a regular expression) in user templates to enforce a specific ID format. The identifier may not contain blank spaces.

items.title: Metadata producers

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the person or organization who produced the metadata or contributed to its production.

props.title: Abbrevation
props.help_text: The abbreviation (or acronym) of the organization that is referenced in "Name".

props.title: Affiliation
props.help_text: The affiliation of the person or organization mentioned in "Name".

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The specific role of the person or organization mentioned in "Name" in the production of the metadata.

items.help_text: The metadata producer is the person or organization with the financial and/or administrative responsibility for the processes whereby the metadata document was created. This is a "Recommended" element. For catalog administration purposes, information on the producer and on the date of metadata production is useful.

items.title: Production date
items.help_text: The date the metadata on this image was produced (not distributed or archived), preferably entered in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYY-MM). A validation rule can be set in user templates to enforce a date format. This is a "Recommended" element, as information on the producer and on the date of metadata production is useful for catalog administration purposes.

items.title: Version
items.help_text: The version of the metadata document (not the version of the image itself).

items.title: Primary ID
items.help_text: A unique identifier of the image. The "Primary ID" (also referred to as IDNO) is a unique identification number used to identify the image. A unique identifier is required for cataloguing purpose, so this element is declared as "Required". The identifier will allow users to cite the table properly. The identifier must be unique within the catalog. Ideally, it should also be globally unique. A Digital Object Identifier (DOI), or the ID included in the EXIF metadata for digital pictures can be used. for the study. Alternatively, the "Primary ID" can be constructed by an organization using a consistent scheme. Note that the schema allows you to provide more than one identifier for a same image (in element "Other identifiers"); a catalog-specific identifier is thus not incompatible with a globally unique identifier like a DOI. A validation rule can be set (using a regular expression) in user templates to enforce a specific ID format. A validation rule can be set (using a regular expression) in user templates to enforce a specific ID format. The identifier may not contain blank spaces.

items.title: Other identifiers
items.help_text: This repeatable element is used to enter identifiers (IDs) other than the "Primary ID" (IDNO). It can for example be a Digital Object Identifier (DOI), or the EXIF identifier. The "Primary ID" can be repeated here (the "Primary ID" does not provide a "Type" parameter, so if a DOI, EXIF, or other standard ID type is used as main identifier, it is recommended to repeat it here with the identification of the type).

props.title: Type
props.help_text: The type of identifier. This could be for example “DOI”, or "EXIF".

props.title: Identifier
props.help_text: The identifier itself.

items.title: Title
items.help_text: The title is a shorthand reference for the digital image. It provides a short verbal and human readable name which can be a text and/or a numeric reference. It is not the same as the Headline (see below). Some may use the title field to store the file name of the image, though the field may be used in many ways. This element should not be used to provide the unique identifier of the image.

items.title: Headline
items.help_text: A brief publishable summary of the contents of the image. Note that a headline is not the same as a title.

items.title: Digital Image GUID
items.help_text:
A globally unique identifier for the image. This identifier is created and applied by the creator of the digital image at the time of its creation. This value shall not be changed after that time. The identifier can be generated using an algorithm that would guarantee that the created identifier is globally unique. Device that create digital images like digital or video cameras or scanners usually create such an identifier at the time of the creation of the digital data, and add it to the metadata embedded in the image file (e.g., the EXIF metadata).IPTC’s requirements for unique ids are as follows:
- It must be globally unique. Algorithms for this purpose exist.
- It should identify the camera body.
- It should identify each individual photo from this camera body.
- It should identify the date and time of the creation of the picture.
- It should be secured against tampering.

items.title: Date created
items.help_text: Designates the date and optionally the time the content of the image was created. For a photo, this will be the date and time the photo was taken. When no information is available on the time, the time is set to 00:00:00. The preferred format for the "Date created" element is the truncated DateTime format, for example: 2021-02-22T21:24:06Z

items.title: Creator name
items.help_text: Enter details about the creator or creators of this image. The Image Creator must often be attributed in association with any use of the image. The Image Creator, Copyright Owner, Image Supplier and Licensor may be the same or different entities.

items.title: Creator job title
items.help_text: The job title of the photographer (the person listed in "Creator name"). The use of this element implies that the photographer information ("Creator name" is not empty).

items.title: Job ID
items.help_text:
Number or identifier for the purpose of improved workflow handling (control or tracking). This is a user created identifier related to the job for which the image is supplied.
Note: As this identifier references a job of the receiver’s workflow it must first be issued by the receiver, then transmitted to the creator or provider of the news object and finally added by the creator to this field.

items.title: Source
items.help_text: The name of a person or party who has a role in the content supply chain. The source can be different from the creator and from the entities listed in the Copyright Notice.

items.title: Supplier
items.help_text: Identifies the most recent supplier of the image, who is not necessarily its owner or creator.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the supplier of the image (person or organization).

props.title: Identifier
props.help_text: The identifier for the most recent supplier of this image. This will not necessarily be the creator or the owner of the image.

items.title: Supplier ID
items.help_text: A unique identifier assigned by the image supplier to the image. This should be one of the IDs entered in either "Primary ID" or "Other identifiers" in section "Identifiers".

items.title: Credit
items.help_text: The credit to person(s) and/or organization(s) required by the supplier of the image to be used when published. This is a free-text field.

items.title: Caption writer
items.help_text: An identifier, or the name, of the person involved in writing, editing or correcting the description of the image.

items.title: Contact

props.title: Country
props.help_text: The country name for the address of the person that created this image.

props.title: Email
props.help_text: The work email address(es) for the creator of the image. Multiple email addresses can be given, in which case they should be separated by a comma.

props.title: Region
props.help_text: The state or province for the address of the creator of the image.

props.title: Phone
props.help_text: The work phone number(s) for the creator of the image. Use the international format including the country code, such as +1 (123) 456789. Multiple numbers can be given, in which case they should be separated by a comma.

props.title: URL
props.help_text: The work web address for the creator of the image. Multiple addresses can be given, in which case they should be separated by a comma.

props.title: Address
props.help_text: The address of the creator of the image. This may comprise a company name.

props.title: City
props.help_text: The city for the address of the person that created the image.

props.title: Postal code
props.help_text: Enter the local postal code for the address of the person who created the image.

items.help_text: The creator’s contact information provides all necessary information to get in contact with the creator of this image and comprises a set of elements for proper addressing. Note that if the creator is also the licensor, his or her contact information should be provided in the licensor fields.

items.title: Description
items.help_text: A textual description, including captions, of the image. This describes the who, what, and why of what is happening in this image. This might include names of people, and/or their role in the action that is taking place within the image. Example: “The president of the Metadata Association delivers the keynote address”.

items.title: Scene codes
items.help_text: The "Scene codes" describe the scene of a photo content. The IPTC Scene-NewsCodes controlled vocabulary (published under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) 4.0 license) should be used, where a scene is represented as a string of 6 digits.

items.title: Scene codes labelled
items.help_text: The "Scene codes" element described above only allows for the capture of codes. To improve discoverability (by indexing important keywords), not only the scene codes but also the scene description should be provided. The IPTC standard does not provide an element that allows the scene label and description to be entered. The "Scene codes labelled" is an element added to the IHSN schema. Ideally, curators will enter the scene codes in the element "Scene codes" to maintain full compatibility with the IPTC, and complement that information by also entering the codes and their description in the "Scene codes labelled" element.

props.title: Code
props.help_text: The code for the scene of a photo content. The IPTC Scene-NewsCodes controlled vocabulary (published under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) 4.0 license) should be used, where a scene is represented as a string of 6 digits. See table above.

props.title: Label
props.help_text: The label of the scene. See table above for examples.

props.title: Description
props.help_text: A more detailed description of the scene. See table above for examples.

items.title: Subject codes
items.help_text: Specifies one or more subjects from the IPTC Subject-NewsCodes controlled vocabulary to categorize the image. Each Subject is represented as a string of 8 digits. The vocabulary consists of about 1400 terms organized into 3 levels (users can decide to use only the first, or the first two levels; the more detail is provided, the better the discoverability of the image).

items.title: Subject codes labelled
items.help_text: The "Subject codes" element described above only allows for the capture of codes. To improve discoverability (by indexing important keywords), not only the subject codes but also the subject description should be provided. The IPTC standard does not provide an element that allows the subject label and description to be entered. The "Subject codes labelled"  is an element that was added to the IHSN schema. Ideally, curators will enter the subject codes in the element "Subject codes" to maintain full compatibility with the IPTC, and complement that information by also entering the codes and their description in the "Subject codes labelled" element.

props.title: Code
props.help_text: Specifies one or more subjects from the IPTC Subject-NewsCodes controlled vocabulary to categorize the image. Each Subject is represented as a string of 8 digits. The vocabulary consists of about 1400 terms organized into 3 levels (users can decide to use only the first, or the first two levels; the more detail is provided, the better the discoverability of the image). See examples in the table above.

props.title: Label
props.help_text: The label of the subject. See table above for examples.

props.title: Description
props.help_text: A more detailed description of the subject. See table above for examples.

items.title: Keywords
items.help_text: Keywords are words or phrases that describe salient aspects of what the image represents. The addition of keywords can significantly improve the discoverability of data and is thus recommended. Keywords can summarize and improve the description of the content or subject matter of a resource. Keywords can be selected from a standard thesaurus, preferably an international, multilingual thesaurus. Or they can be suggested by machine learning models. A controlled vocabulary can be defined in user templates.

items.title: Event name
items.help_text: The name or a brief description of the event where the image was taken. If this is a sub-event of a larger event, mention both in the description. For example: “Opening statement, 1st International Conference on Metadata Standards, New York, November 2021”.

items.title: Location shown
items.help_text: This block of elements is used to document the location shown in the image. This information should be provided with as much detail as possible. It contains elements that can be used to provide a “nested” description of the location, from a high geographic level (world region) down to a very specific location (city and sub-location within a city).

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The full name of the location.

props.title: Identifier
props.help_text: A globally unique identifier of the location shown.

props.title: World region
props.help_text: The name of a world region. This element is at the first (top) level of the top-down geographical hierarchy.

props.title: Country name
props.help_text: The name of a country of a location. This element is at the second level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.

props.title: Country code
props.help_text: The ISO code of the country mentioned in "Country name".

props.title: Sub-region
props.help_text: The name of a sub-region of the country - for example a province or a state name. This element is at the third level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.

props.title: City
props.help_text: The name of the city. This element is at the fourth level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.

props.title: Sub-location
props.help_text: The sublocation name could either be the name of a sublocation to a city or the name of a well known location or (natural) monument outside a city. This element is at the fifth (lowest) level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.

props.title: GPS altitude
props.help_text: The altitude in meters of a WGS84 based position of this location.

props.title: GPS latitude
props.help_text: Latitude of a WGS84 based position of this location (in some cases, this information may be contained in the EXIF metadata).

props.title: GPS longitude
props.help_text: Longitude of a WGS84 based position of this location (in some cases, this information may be contained in the EXIF metadata).

items.title: Genres
items.help_text: Artistic, style, journalistic, product or other genre(s) of the image (expressed by a term from any controlled vocabulary).

props.title: Vocabulary ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the Controlled Vocabulary the term is from.

props.title: Term label
props.help_text: The natural language name of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: Term ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: About
props.help_text: Optionally enter a refinement of the "about" relationship of the term with the content of the image. This must be a globally unique identifier from a Controlled Vocabulary. May be used to refine the generic about relationship.

items.title: Intellectual genre
items.help_text: A term to describe the nature of the image in terms of its intellectual or journalistic characteristics (for example “actuality”, “interview”, “background”, “feature”, “summary”, “wrapup” for journalistic genres, or “daybook”, “obituary”, “press release”, “transcript” for news category related genres. It is advised to use terms from a controlled vocabulary such as the NewsCodes Scheme published by the IPTC under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) 4.0 license.

items.title: Copyright notice
items.help_text: Contains any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for this photograph and should identify the current owner of the copyright for the photograph. Other entities like the creator of the photograph may be added in the corresponding field. Notes on usage rights should be provided in “Rights usage terms”. Example: ©2008 Jane Doe. If the copyright ownership must be expressed in a more controlled manner, use the fields “Copyright Owner”, “Copyright Owner ID”, “Copyright Owner Name” described below instead of the "Copyright notice" element.

items.title: Copyright owners
items.help_text: Owner or owners of the copyright in the licensed image, described in a structured format (as an alternative to the element "Copyright notice"). This block serves the same purpose of identifying the rights holder/s for the image. The Copyright Owner, Image Creator and Licensor may be the same or different entities.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the owner of the copyright in the licensed image.

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The role the entity.

props.title: Identifier
props.help_text: The globally-unique identifier of the owner of the copyright in the licensed image.

items.title: Usage terms
items.help_text: The licensing parameters of the image expressed in free-text. Enter instructions on how this image can legally be used. The PLUS fields of the IPTC Extension can be used in parallel to express the licensed usage in more controlled terms.

items.title: Rights expression
items.help_text: An embedded rights expression using a rights expression language which is encoded as a string. Embedded Encoded Rights Expression (EERE) structure A structure providing details of an embedded encoded rights expression.

props.title: Encoded rights expression
props.help_text: Rights Expression Language ID. An identifier of the rights expression language used by the rights expression.

props.title: Encoding type
props.help_text: The encoding type of the rights expression, identified by an IANA Media Type.

props.title: Rights expression language ID
props.help_text: An embedded rights expression using any rights expression language.

items.title: Linked rights expression
items.help_text: Link to encoded rights expression.

props.title: Link to encoded rights expression
props.help_text: The link to a web resource representing an encoded rights expression.

props.title: Encoding type
props.help_text: The encoding type of the rights expression, identified by an IANA Media Type.

props.title: Rights expression language ID
props.help_text: The identifier of the rights expression language used by the rights expression.

items.title: Web statement rights
items.help_text: URL referencing a web resource providing a statement of the copyright ownership and usage rights of the image.

items.title: Instructions to users
items.help_text: Instructions from the provider or creator to the receiver of the image which might include any of the following: embargoes and other restrictions not covered by the “Rights Usage Terms” field; information regarding the original means of capture (scanning notes, colourspace info) or other specific text information that the user may need for accurate reproduction; additional permissions required when publishing; credits for publishing if they exceed the IIM length of the credit field.

items.title: Property release status
items.help_text: This summarizes the availability and scope of property releases authorizing usage of the properties appearing in the photograph. One value should be selected from a controlled vocabulary. It is recommended to apply the value PR-UPR very carefully and to check the wording of the property release thoroughly before applying it.

props.title: Vocabulary ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the controlled vocabulary the term is from.

props.title: Term label
props.help_text: The natural language name of the term from a controlled vocabulary.

props.title: Term ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: About
props.help_text: Refined "about" relationship of the CV-Term. The refined "about" relationship of the term with the content. Optionally enter a refinement of the "About" relationship of the term with the content of the image. This must be a globally unique identifier from a Controlled Vocabulary.

items.title: Property release documents
items.help_text: Optional identifier associated with each Property Release.

items.title: Art work, objects, products in image
Art work or object
items.help_text: This block provides a set of metadata elements to be used to describe the object or artwork shown in the image.

props.title: Title
props.help_text: A human readable name of the object or artwork shown in the image.

props.title: Content description
props.help_text: A textual description of the content depicted in the object or artwork.

props.title: Physical description
props.help_text: A textual description of the physical characteristics of the artwork or object, without reference to the content depicted. This would be used to describe the object type, materials, techniques, and measurements.

props.title: Creator name
props.help_text: The name of the person(s) (possibly an organization) who created the object or artwork shown in the image.

props.title: Creator identifier
props.help_text: One or multiple globally unique identifier(s) for the artist who created the artwork or object shown in the image. This could be an identifier issued by an online registry of persons or companies. Make sure to enter these identifiers in the exact same sequence as the names entered in the field "Creator names".

props.title: Contribution description
props.help_text: A description of any contributions made to the artwork or object. It should include the type, date and location of contribution, and details about the contributor.

props.title: Style period
props.help_text: The style, historical or artistic period, movement, group, or school whose characteristics are represented in the artwork or object. It is advised to take the terms from a controlled vocabulary.

props.title: Date created
props.help_text: Designates the date and optionally the time the artwork or object in the image was created. This relates to artwork or objects with associated intellectual property rights. Expected format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+hh:mm

props.title: Circa date created
props.help_text: The approximate date or range of dates associated with the creation and production of an artwork or object or its components.

props.title: Source
props.help_text: The name of the organization or body holding and registering the artwork or object in this image for inventory purposes.

props.title: Source inventory number
props.help_text: The inventory number issued by the organization or body holding and registering the artwork or object in the image.

props.title: Source inventory URL
props.help_text: A reference URL for the metadata record of the inventory maintained by the Source.

props.title: Current copyright owner name
props.help_text: The name of the current owner of the copyright of the artwork or object.

props.title: Current copyright owner ID
props.help_text: A globally unique identifier for the current copyright owner e.g. issued by an online registry of persons or companies.

props.title: Copyright notice
props.help_text: Any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for artwork or an object in the image and should identify the current owner of the copyright of this work with associated intellectual property rights.

props.title: Current licensor name
props.help_text: Name of the current licensor of the artwork or object.

props.title: Current licensor ID
props.help_text: A globally unique identifier for the current licensor e.g. issued by an online registry of persons or companies.

items.title: Products shown
items.help_text:
Details about a product shown in the image.

- Description: 
- GTIN: 
- Name:

props.title: Description
props.help_text: A textual description of the product.

props.title: GTIN
props.help_text: The Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) of the product (GTIN-8 to GTIN-14 codes can be used).

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the product.

items.title: Persons shown (names)
items.help_text: This repeatable block of elements is used to provide information on the person(s) shown in the image.

items.title: Persons shown (detail)
items.help_text:
Details about person(s) shown in the image. It is not required to list all, just those details which can be recognized.

- Name: 
- Description: 
- Identifiers: 
- Characteristics: 
- Vocabulary ID: 
- cvTermName: 
- cvTermId: 
- cvTermRefinedAbout:

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of a person shown in the image.

props.title: Description
props.help_text: A textual description of the person. For example, you may include actions taken, emotional expressions shown and more.

props.title: Identifiers
props.help_text: Globally unique identifier of the person, such as those from WikiData.

props.title: Characterstics
props.help_text: A property or trait of the person, provided as a term selected from a controlled vocabulary.

props.title: Vocabulary ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the Controlled Vocabulary the term is from.

props.title: Term label
props.help_text: The natural language name of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: Term ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the term from a controlled vocabulary.

props.title: About
props.help_text: The refined "about" relationship of the term with the content. Optionally enter a refinement of the ‘about’ relationship of the term with the content of the image. This must be a globally unique identifier from a controlled vocabulary.

items.title: Model ages
items.help_text: Age of the human model(s) at the time the image was taken. Be aware of any legal implications of providing ages for young models. Ages below 18 years should not be included.

items.title: Additional model information
items.help_text: Information about other facets of the model(s).

items.title: Minor model age disclosure
items.help_text: The age of the youngest model pictured in the image, at the time the image was created. This information is not intended to be displayed publicly; it is intended to be used as a filter for inclusion/exclusion of images in catalogs and dissemination processes.

items.title: Model release documents
items.help_text: Identifier associated with each Model Release.

items.title: Model release status
items.help_text: Summarizes the availability and scope of model releases authorizing usage of the likenesses of persons appearing in the photograph.

props.title: Vocabulary ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the Controlled Vocabulary the term is from.

props.title: Term label
props.help_text: The natural language name of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: Term ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the term from a controlled vocabulary.

props.title: About
props.help_text: The refined "about" relationship of the term with the content. Optionally enter a refinement of the "About" relationship of the term with the content of the image. This must be a globally unique identifier from a Controlled Vocabulary. May be used to refine the generic about relationship.

items.title: Organization in image - Name
items.help_text: The name of the organization or company which is featured in the image.

items.title: Organization in image - Code
items.help_text: The code, extracted from a controlled vocabulary, used to identify the organization or company featured in the image. For example a stock ticker symbol may be used. Enter an identifier for the controlled vocabulary, then a colon, and finally the code from the vocabulary assigned to the organization (e.g. nasdaq:companyA)

items.title: Image rating
items.help_text: Rating of the image by its user or supplier. The value shall be -1 or in the range 0 to 5. -1 indicates “rejected” and 0 “unrated”. If an explicit value is not provided, the default value is 0 will be assumed.

items.title: Digital source type
items.help_text:
The type of the source of this digital image. 
Must be URL.
One value should be selected from the IPTC controlled vocabulary (published under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) 4.0 license license) that contains the following values (type/source/description):

- digitalCapture | Original digital capture of a real life scene | The digital image is the original and only instance and was taken by a digital camera
- negativeFilm | Digitized from a negative on film | The digital image was digitized from a negative on film on any other transparent medium
- positiveFilm | Digitized from a positive on film | The digital image was digitized from a positive on a transparency or any other transparent medium
- print | Digitized from a print on non-transparent medium | The digital image was digitized from an image printed on a non-transparent medium
- softwareImage | Created by software | The digital image was created by computer software

items.title: Maximum available height
items.help_text: The maximum available height in pixels of the original photo from which this photo has been derived by downsizing.

items.title: Maximum available width
items.help_text: The maximum available width in pixels of the original photo from which this photo has been derived by downsizing.

items.title: Registry entries
items.help_text: A structured element used to provide cataloguing information (i.e. an entry in a registry). It includes the unique identifier for the image issued by the registry and the registry’s organization identifier.

props.title: Role
props.help_text: An identifier of the reason and/or purpose for this Registry Entry.

props.title: Asset Identifier
props.help_text: A unique identifier created by the registry and applied by the creator of the digital image. This value shall not be changed after being applied. This identifier is linked to a corresponding Registry Organization Identifier. Enter the unique identifier created by a registry and applied by the creator of the digital image. This value shall not be changed after being applied. This identifier may be globally unique by itself, but it must be unique for the issuing registry. An input to this field should be made mandatory.

props.title: Registry Identifier
props.help_text: An identifier for the registry/organization which issued the corresponding Registry Image Id.

items.title: aboutCvTerms
items.help_text: Topics, themes or entities the content is about

props.title: Vocabulary ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the controlled vocabulary the term is from

props.title: Term label
props.help_text: The natural language name of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: Term ID
props.help_text: The globally unique identifier of the term from a Controlled Vocabulary.

props.title: Details
props.help_text: The refined "about" relationship of the term with the content.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the license.

props.title: URL
props.help_text: A URL where detailed information on the license / terms of use can be found.
